title: [ENH] Design and API for Early Classification
body:
Early classification revolves around allowing classifiers to take incomplete series (i.e, the first half of a series recorded over a day) and decide whether it can make an accurate prediction or not with the presented partial time series. These algorithms are similar enough to the rest of the classification package that they could just reside in a sub-package for now, such as `classification/early_classification`.

While most of the current classification API is suitable for these algorithms, some issues may arise and will require discussion: 
- How do we deal with an algorithm refusing to make a prediction? Both in the sense of what would we actually return (`None` seems reasonable) and how would we go about testing, as returning this is likely to break some of the standard classifier ones.
- How do we verify input when predicting? Some algorithms can only make decisions at specific series lengths (commonly in 5% intervals), do any additions need to be made for this, or should it be left to the individual algorithm? 
- Some algorithms keep data from previous prediction attempts, i.e. a decision at 15% of the series may use information from the decisions at 5% and 10%. Do we require any additional predict inputs to accommodate this? How do we reset for new data when predicting?
- Do we require an extended base class for any of this? Would having it anyway help with testing, or would it be better as a tag?

Good first implementations would be [TEASER](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10618-020-00690-z) and a simple probability threshold for making the decision.
